title: SPACK_SHELL not being set to actual shell when using spack bootstrap
body:
### Expected Result

`SPACK_SHELL=bash`, etc

### Actual Result

`SPACK_SHELL=<name of script in which it is running>`

### Steps to reproduce the issue

Run `setup-env.sh` in a script after using `spack bootstrap`.

```
[user@machine ~]$ cat script.sh 
#!/bin/bash
export SPACK_ROOT=${HOME}/spack
source ${SPACK_ROOT}/share/spack/setup-env.sh
echo $SPACK_SHELL
[user@machine ~]$ ./script.sh 
script.sh
```

### Information on your system

Centos 7. Can't seem to recreate this problem on OSX.

### Other Notes

The code which sets `SPACK_SHELL` is as such:
```
function _spack_determine_shell() {
        ps -p $$ | tail -n 1 | awk '{print $4}' | sed 's/^-//' | xargs basename
}
export SPACK_SHELL=$(_spack_determine_shell)
```

Maybe there is good reason to do it that way instead of extracting it out of `$SHELL`, but I think it might need a more robust function to resolve the current shell so it works within a script.

Edit: `export SPACK_SHELL=$(basename $SHELL)` maybe?
